events.title: Bay of Pigs Invasion Begins
events.description: A CIA-sponsored paramilitary group of Cuban exiles landed at the Bay of Pigs in Cuba in an unsuccessful attempt to overthrow Fidel Castro's government.
events.significance: This event marked a significant Cold War conflict in the Americas and was a major embarrassment for the U.S. government.

events.title: Erwin Rommel Arrives in North Africa
events.description: Field Marshal Erwin Rommel arrived in Tripoli, Libya, to command the German Afrika Korps during World War II.
events.significance: Rommel's leadership significantly influenced the North African Campaign, affecting control over the Mediterranean.

events.title: Christopher Columbus Sets Sail
events.description: Christopher Columbus departed from Palos de la Frontera, Spain, on his first voyage across the Atlantic Ocean.
events.significance: This voyage led to the European discovery of the Americas, initiating widespread contact between Europe and the New World.

events.title: First Meeting of the United Nations Security Council
events.description: The inaugural session of the UN Security Council was held in London, marking the beginning of its role in maintaining global peace and security.
events.significance: Established a key mechanism for international diplomatic security efforts after World War II.

events.title: Cuba Gains Independence from the United States
events.description: The Republic of Cuba was officially established, ending American military occupation following the Spanish-American War.
events.significance: Marked the beginning of Cuban sovereignty and a significant shift in U.S.-Cuban relations.
